attributes.action: More citizen, human and working rights lessons into the educational curriculum
attributes.background: a lot of blood and tears was spilled building the cornerstones of what rights we enjoy today as humans, citizens and workers. Unfortunately a lot of young people miss out on this vital information and children should be educated about what rights they have so they are prepared for the real world

attributes.action: Electrocardiogram (ECG) scans should be made compulsory for all young people.
attributes.background: Test every teenager for deadly undiagnosed heart defects that kills 12 people every week in the UK. 80% of heart defects are found through ECG scans, as there are no symptoms - meaning hundreds of lives would be saved each year. One in 500 people suffer and their hearts could stop at any point.
attributes.additional_details: Renowned cardiologist Professor Sanjay Sharma, medical director for the virgin London Marathon and Professor of Cardiology at St George's University Hospital, agrees saying: 'Each week 12 young people in the UK die suddenly from a heart condition they didn't know they had.' 'The vast majority of those - more than 80% - won't have symptoms, but the same proportion would have been picked up through a three minute ECG.'

attributes.action: There Must be Prison For Attacks on Police, Minimum Prison Sentence Six Months.
attributes.background: As we rely on the Police for Protection so they Must be Protected when Attacked, Courts should never let the Attackers off with just a Slap on the Hand, Respect is needed not only for the Police but All Emergency Services who do a Great and sometimes Difficult Job, Letâ€™s get them some redress.
attributes.additional_details:
Far too many are getting Attacked these days and costing money in Sick pay which could be spent on Services.

Please support this and get them backing in our Courts.

Thanks

attributes.action: Create an international phone number for UK emergency services.
attributes.background: There have been cases in the media of people attempting suicide over live streaming on social media sites or posing a danger to themselves online. These situations have been streamed internationally but people in foreign countries are not able to report these incidents in the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: An international UK emergency service number, I believe, is vital and would allow for people abroad to report an incident first hand and potentially speed up the response to incidents of such a nature.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of time children have to spend at school
attributes.background: We need to reduce the amount of time children spend at school, this is due to the negative effects that can be caused to children if they spend extended periods of time at school like depression. I ask that the UK Government reduce the amount of time a child in the UK has to spend at school.

attributes.action: Include tax exempt income in child maintenance payments.
attributes.background: Child maintenance payments do not include tax-exempt income. For example, a parent who was injured in war can receive thousands of pounds per month in tax-exempt pension. Of this they would only have to pay a few pounds per week to their child.
attributes.additional_details: How is it ok that the government remove financial responsibility for children when it can clearly be afforded?

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public transport (buses) to be fitted with seatbelts.
attributes.background: In light of the two elderly ladies who were recently injured on a public transport bus.

attributes.action: Put grammar schools in all counties
attributes.background: Lots of high school children are held back in their current schools. If they go to a grammar school they will be encouraged, pushed, and will improve greatly!

attributes.action: More funding for the National Health Service and take it out of crisis
attributes.background: I have seen casualty departments where people are begging for help, I've seen where patients are being kept in corridors and I've seen nurses and doctors struggle to provide the appropriate care required when they are stretched to their limit.

attributes.action: Introduce compensation  for misleading people to buy diesel cars
attributes.background: We were told to buy diesel cars a few years ago and now we are being told to buy electric cars. If you have a diesel car you have to pay to enter into London when the government were the ones who told us to get diesel cars as they are better. I think we should get money from the government for this
attributes.additional_details: I believe we should get compensation for this as we were told to buy diesel cars and now we have to pay extra for someone's mistake

attributes.action: Reverse the planned ban on letting agent fees to tenants
attributes.background: The UK Government is currently putting a bill through Parliament to ban letting agents or landlords from charging any fees to tenants for renting a home. This ban will likely put costs to tenants up so we would like to see it reversed before primary legislation is passed as a cap is more appropriate
attributes.additional_details: A ban on fees to tenants will simply push these costs onto landlords who are a long way from all being able to afford them. This will drive up rents and drive down standards and, crucially, reduce supply as landlords are squeezed on top of recent tax changes. Asking prospective tenants to make a reasonable contribution to the vetting process is in no way unreasonable and a cap is a perfectly workable compromise. The Governmentâ€™s broken housing policy needs private landlords right now.

attributes.action: Ban (Prospective) Employers asking about salary history from job applicants
attributes.background: Law makers say asking about salary history continues the cycle of pay inequality and makes it harder for people to change careers/jobs. The salary question is a hidden,yet,pervasive form of discrimination. It enables employers to use potential employee's past salary to determine the salary to offer.
attributes.additional_details:
Some states in the U.S (e.g. New York city) has already passed the law (in 2017) prohibiting employers to ask about salary history in interviews or on applications.
By banning the question during the hiring process, employers will be required to offer jobs and compensation to prospective employees based on their own skills, merit and demands of the job, not gender, race or ethnicity.
Banning salary history question is the next step to take in the fight to end the pay gap.

attributes.action: Prevent UK universities classifying British citizens as international students.
attributes.background:
Currently, a British citizen must live in the UK for the 3 years before starting university. This discriminates against citizens who have lived abroad. 

The loose fee-status specifications allow for different institutions to classify the same student as an international and a home student.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite being a British citizen, I am currently paying Â£20,000 per year to attend Durham University. 

The Department for Education justifies this by claiming British Citizens who have lived abroad have no access to public funds when they return to the UK, but there is no equivalent barrier to benefits, the NHS, or similar means of public funds. 

This is a call to end the discrimination, not a request to access the Students Loan Company. This is a demand to be treated as equal.

attributes.action: Abolish business rates and replace with business rates transaction charge
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  These disproportionate business rates are contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% business rates charge levied on the sales value of each transaction would be a fair arrangement and would be linked directly to the success of a retail business. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place.  The credit card holderâ€™s physical location or credit card address is readily available for governmentâ€™s re-distribution to the local authorities.

attributes.action: Change the law so that in court each side always pays their own legal costs
attributes.background: Going to court is hugely in favour of the party with the biggest financial clout. They can afford to risk legal costs that the smaller party can't. The smaller party has no control over the larger parties cost yet may have to pay them. There is no other business where you can't control your costs.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for people to pass a politics test before they can vote
attributes.background: Make it a requirement for people to have to pass a political competency test in order to be allowed to vote in General Elections, or in Nationwide Referendums. Brexit is a stark reminder; it only takes a small percentage of the population to be politically uneducated to sway a huge national decision
attributes.additional_details: A exam to test background knowledge of basic political systems, taken a few weeks before an upcoming election. This could then be marked over the following days, and anyone who passed will be sent a verification code or something similar to enable them to vote on Election Day. An in depth analysis of how the population did overall on the exam could then be published, allowing political parties to see what areas of knowledge/ which demographics they could address in future election campaigns.

attributes.action: Require 5-year warranty on electrical goods to reduce environmental impact
attributes.background: White goods, TVs and other electrical items often break shortly after their warranty has expired and are often not economically viable to repair. Manufacturers should have to take greater care to ensure these items are better quality and fit for use for many years to reduce the environmental impact.

attributes.action: Hold a snap election in response to Theresa May's poor leadership over Syria.
attributes.background: Theresa May's decision to approve air strikes in Syria without consulting the British parliament should not go unchallenged. Her lack of consideration has called the safety of this country into question and put innocent lives of the Syrian people in danger.

attributes.action: Outlaw the use of gas gun type bird scarers.  They dont work and are a nuisance
attributes.background:
Gas gun type bird scarers are used by farmers to scare birds from their crops.
They periodically make a series of loud bangs to scare the birds.
The loud bang also scares passers by, horse and dogs.
The birds return after a few minutes making them ineffective and a nuisance.
attributes.additional_details:
There do not appear to be any statutory restrictions on the the use of gas guns but the NFU has guidelines on their use:- https://www.nfuonline.com/assets/4662

The guidelines are largely ignored, the gas guns are inevitably plonked in a field and forgotten about.
Their proliferation has made the countryside sound like a battlefield.

Given how ineffective they are and the number of them that are thoughtlessly deployed (too many for local authority control). They should be outlawed.

attributes.action: Remove chargeable road tax for UK vehicles over 30 years old
attributes.background:
Currently as it stands the total value of road tax paid on my classic car since new now out-values the value of the car itself today ! and also may be higher than the original RRP of the vehicle in 1986.
I hereby request to open a petition to remove chargeable road tax on vehicles over 30 years old

attributes.action: Halt arms sales to Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia has carried out indiscriminate airstrikes in Yemen which have resulted in thousands of civilian deaths.
attributes.additional_details: These have been allowed by the British government's licensing of Â£4.6bn of arms sales to the kingdom since the start of the Yemeni Civil War in 2015. Saudi Arabia's blockade of Yemen has also resulted in the worst humanitarian crisis in the world.

attributes.action: Change the law to ensure that NICE guidance outweighs the "Bolam Test"
attributes.background: I have suffered a heart attack which left me disabled. I allege this was due to sub-standard practices. However, solicitors say that my case would not meet the 'Bolam Test', in that, if a similar expert would have 'done the same thing' then a claim will fail even if NICE guidance has been ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Nice Guidance states that â€œIf you currently have chest pain ... you may need to go to hospital as an emergency ... if you do not currently have chest pain and your ECG was normal â€¦ you should have an assessment in hospital on the same day" 
(Solicitor's response - below) 
".. NICE guidelines are recommendations ... advice they provide should not be compared to .. many years of professional experience".

attributes.action: Repair pot holed roads by introduction of vignette system for foreign drivers
attributes.background: Many countries in Europe make road users pay to use motorways and major roads, either by way of tolls or a vignette system. I propose introducing a Vignette system in the UK for foreign drivers which would raise revenue to be shared amongst the counties and used solely for repairing road surfaces.
attributes.additional_details: Pot holes in UK roads are increasing due to councils lack of funds for repairs. This causes serious safety issues for drivers and cyclists and can cause major damage to vehicles.

attributes.action: Raise the Penalty for Uninsured Motorists
attributes.background: Currently the penalty for driving a motor vehicle with no insurance is Â£300 and 6 points on your license. With this being the case, millions of motorists take the gamble!
attributes.additional_details:
If you are involved in a road traffic accident that was not a fault of your own, usually the third partyâ€™s insurance would cover the damage to your vehicle and your insurance excess. If however, the third party is an uninsured driver, this then falls on you to recover your costs. 

Millions of motorists are uninsured because the penalty for doing so is not severe enough. A Â£300 fine is cheaper than most annual insurance quotes!

The fine should be more severe to prevent this from happening.

attributes.action: Bring Back Capital Punishment For Convicted Terrorists.
attributes.background:
Over 30 lives have been claimed in attacks in the UK since 2016 which has left the UK terrified.
Anyone that performs terrorist attacks against the UK should be faced with capital punishment once proven guilty.
Many citizens of the UK feel a life sentence in prison isn't enough to satisfy justice.

attributes.action: Give anyone who has a long-term health condition medication on the NHS
attributes.background:
Some people end up needing hospital treatment because they cannot afford their medication. 

Health officials say they have made sure people with chronic illnesses have access to affordable prescription but the current system is arbitrary and unfair.
attributes.additional_details: People with Diabetes have their medication and equipments on the NHS but what about people who have the leading cause of death being Heart Disease in the UK/World-wide? Conditions such as Heart Disease, Crohns or Parkinson's etc should be available on the NHS, doing this could save thousands of lives.

attributes.action: Increase armed forces budget
attributes.background: We believe that the armed forces are receiving too little in budget and pay. and we believe that they should get more money due to the fact that everyday their life is put on the line.

attributes.action: To debate the impact of not returning FULL control of our fisheries to the UK.
attributes.background: The decision to continue to allow EU fishing vessels access to UK  waters crosses political boundaries as the current EU policy is damaging our fish stocks and our fishing industry. It needs to be a Brexit negotiation red line as a plastic free ocean without fish is failure

attributes.action: Ban the use and sale of all non-recyclable plastics in the UK by 2025
attributes.background:
Plastic is a direct threat to the long term survival of all species, with the amount of plastic pollution in the oceans and land expanding at a catastrophic rate.
HM Government's strategy on plastic waste is inadequate in its current form and must be reviewed to ban all harmful plastics by 2025.

attributes.action: Invite Vladimir Putin to the UK to discuss UK-Russia relations
attributes.background:
Britain's most famous Prime Minister Winston Churchill said "Jaw Jaw is better than War War". 
If he refuses to come it will speak volumes. If he does come maybe we can avert a tit-for-tat escalation.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Business Rates for Small Businesses
attributes.background: Business Rates in this country are driving existing Businesses into debt and liquidation, preventing them from expanding and new Businesses from forming. The extortionate cost of Business Rates are set far too high and there is very little help available and no incentive for Local Councils to help
attributes.additional_details: To run a Business, premises are often required. Different types of Businesses have different requirements. For example, a Small Office Business may run with low Business Rates and a high turn-over. Where as a Small Manufacturer may require a much larger premises, huge Business Rates, and have a smaller profit margin. We need a fairer and balanced Business Rates system that works for the different types of Businesses, because at the moment it is killing our Small Businesses and preventing growth

attributes.action: Make vast changes to how the DWP treat people with mental health disorders
attributes.background:
DWP health assessments are a hellish experience for sufferers of mental health disorders. 
I suggest:
- Cutting wait time for assessments
- Own doctors do them
- DWP penalised if they cancel on the day
- Contact to be made more sensitively, in a way that wonâ€™t aggravate our conditions
attributes.additional_details: No allowances are made by the DWP for mental health conditions. They need to properly differentiate between physical and mental ability when noting our capabilities. An assessment with a stranger is incredibly difficult- itâ€™s hard enough to tell family of our issues. Waiting for a DWP assessment is awful; weeks worrying about whatâ€™s to come. Two years now Iâ€™ve arrived and been turned away as theyâ€™re running behind, meaning Iâ€™ve had to suffer the anxiety of waiting all over again. Horrific.

attributes.action: Make snow days a compulsory paid day off
attributes.background: We are asking the government to make snow days a compulsory paid day off we ask that under a amber warning for snow that if you cannot get into work or the company that you work for does not trade that we are paid for it

attributes.action: Ban diesel cars, post-Brexit
attributes.background: Diesel NOx cheating kills 23,500 UK people a year prematurely, at 10 times the USAâ€™s gun death rate. The UK cannot wait 23 years and see 540,500 die early. We must follow the Germans and ban diesels immediately Post-Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
Last July, the UK banned diesel cars by 2040, because EU diesel testing failure had worsened breaching of NOx targets. Many German cities exceed EU limits. So, last February, Germanyâ€™s highest court ruled that cities can ban the worst diesels.

Car makers and politicians move between both spheres in Germany, the major EU budget contributor. It got EU CO2 regulations to favour diesel, ignoring NOx. VW cheated on emission testing. With 3 jailed, police are investigating 3 of VWâ€™s top people.

attributes.action: Examine viable options for nationalising Thames Water.
attributes.background: In March 2018 up to 20,000 London households suffered an unplanned interruption in their water supply.  This lasted several days and caused significant hardship and distress. It was likely due to vital infrastructure being unable to cope with adverse weather conditions due to underinvestment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/jan/09/nationalise-rail-gas-water-privately-owned

https://www.theguardian.com/business/nils-pratley-on-finance/2017/nov/24/thames-water-explains-why-nationalisation-is-suddenly-popular

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2017/07/01/thames-water-bows-ofwat-pressure-chairman-heads-exit/

https://www.ofwat.gov.uk/ofwat-statement-thames-water-leakage-commitments/

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/nov/30/thames-water-ofwat-performance

attributes.action: Bring Home The QE2
attributes.background:
The QE2 was the last of the great liners build on Clydeside. 
In 2008 it was sold to a company in Dubai, since then it has been sitting in a dock rotting with no work been carried out on it.
I think the British Government should purchase the ship and bring it back to the Clyde. Where it Belongs.

attributes.action: Stop schools being able to confiscate phones for more than the shool day.
attributes.background: Many schools confiscate phones if they are seen or heard. However the problem arises when schools confiscate a phone overnight or sometimes over multiple days. Kids should have right to bring their phones to school and also take them back at the end of the day.
attributes.additional_details: Our school has created a rule where if any phone makes a noise or is seen during the school day (including break) it will be confiscated and you will have to collect at the end of the following day. This is also the case in many other schools. Due to kids signing a 'home school agreement' which apparently gives them the right to do this. The government should assign rules that restrict schools from being allowed to take phones over night.

attributes.action: Abolish section 58 highways act 1980
attributes.background: I dont think local councils should be able to use this act as a get out clause for not maintaining the roads to a higher standard.
attributes.additional_details: The roads are in a terrible state all over the country but councils are getting out of paying for the damage to all modes of transport on the roads due to this section 58 act. If they are unaware of the pot hole they cant fix it so its not their fault, thats great but if we let a payment slip or the likes of car insurance lapse we cant just say I never knew about it and be let off. Ignorance is not an excuse for us and should be the same for them do more thorough checks and sort out the roads.

attributes.action: No transfer of powers to councils to fine motorists for minor traffic offences
attributes.background: Town halls want to rake in more cash by securing sweeping new powers to impose fines on motorists for minor traffic offences.  The Local Government Association want government to transfer powers to them that are currently only available to the police.
attributes.additional_details: The Local Government Association have already started the process of lobbying government in the form of the Department of Transport.  They believe that they are better suited to this enforcement than the police.  This has already been rejected once, but they are continuing to put pressure on government for the change.  We already know that local government isn't about making things safer it's purely a revenue raising exercise and again the motorist is yet again being seen as a cash cow.

attributes.action: Ban credit checks for job applications
attributes.background: Most jobs now require credit checks. All of us have a past - should we be judged on our credit? does it affect our ability to work?
attributes.additional_details: The majority of people have at least one debt or more, especially trying to survive on benefits.

attributes.action: Make driving tests graded to reduce premiums for safer new drivers
attributes.background: Insurance premiums continue to rise for new drivers, as all new drivers are classed as a high risk to the road. By having a grading system in place in the practical driving exam, then the examiner will be able to judge the driver's safety. This may allow a reduction in premiums for safer drivers.

attributes.action: Make sending sexual photo/film with or WITHOUT intent to cause distress illegal
attributes.background:
Section 33 of Criminal Justice and Court Act 2015
1)It is an offence for a person to disclose a private sexual photograph or film if the disclosure is made
(a)without the consent of an individual who appears in the photograph or film, and
(b)with the intention of causing that individual distress.
attributes.additional_details:
In section (8) the law says: "A person charged with an offence under this section is not to be taken to have disclosed a photograph or film with the intention of causing distress merely because that was a natural and probable consequence of the disclosure"

This law creates a loophole for criminals who did not consider their victim's reaction or the probable consequences of disclosure. The law needs to be reworded to 'with or without intent to cause distress' as the victim suffers despite intent

attributes.action: Free residential or nursing care for everyone who fought during WW 2.
attributes.background: People who risked their lives for our country are now forced to give up everything to pay for their care.

attributes.action: Remove VAT from home insulation and damp proofing products.
attributes.background:
Home insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion are the top three most effective and simple means of reducing energy cost and emissions whilst improving environmental health.
Charging VAT on insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion is hobbling those who do most to help the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The laws of physics and the governments own agencies agree with the priorities for energy efficiency and reduction of environmental cost/ damage.
Removal of VAT would be the single, simplest and most effective action whilst avoiding the high administration cost of the more complex and corruptible schemes.

attributes.action: Require all schools to teach children about the severity of acid attacks.
attributes.background: We have recently seen increasing numbers in the amount of these life-changing acid attacks. For example, in 2012 the attack of Naomi Oni, who had acid chucked on her whilst walking through London. Since, 2012 acid attacks have doubled. It is vital that we educate children about this danger.
attributes.additional_details: Last year there were more than 450 acid attacks in London alone. Many have argued to make the sale of acids more regulated and that you should no longer to be able to 'buy it over the counter' however I do not think this is how we should tackle this problem. By further regulating the sale of acids we will not stop the problem directly, however by educating our youth on the effects of these life-changing attacks, we will hopefully see a decrease in the number of attacks in areas such as London.

attributes.action: The Government should publish all its analysis on the economic impact of Brexit
attributes.background:
The Government has acknowledged in Parliament that it has conducted analysis forecasting the economic impact of leaving the EU on the UK economy after the documents were partially leaked to Buzzfeed News.

The public have a right to know what Treasury experts predict for the UK's future.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.buzzfeed.com/albertonardelli/the-governments-own-brexit-analysis-says-the-uk-will-be?utm_term=.suGk63kxj#.rgPqdXqOy

attributes.action: Implement Nutrition Education In the School System
attributes.background: Nutrition is part of everyone's mind everyday and most having no knowledge of what a nutritionally balanced, delicious meal consists of is absurd. Type 2 Diabetes, Coronary Heart Disease, and Obesity are on the rise. People depend on pills for the rest of their lives when a healthy diet is the cure.
attributes.additional_details: A plant-based diet according to research has been shown to reverse the diseases above. NHS money, time, and resources are being wasted as people believe drugs and pills are the way to health.  People resort to taking weight loss pills, statins (cholesterol-lowering drugs), and blood pressure-reducing pills yet have a heavily processed meal several times a day as they have no way out due to education. The NHS spends Â£14 billion pounds for type 2 diabetes alone! Think of where that money could go!

attributes.action: Abolish all customs tariffs against developing countries after Brexit.
attributes.background: Please ensure that developing countries do not face the cold shoulder of protectionism so that they are able to trade fairly and freely with us, please do this by unilaterally abolishing customs tariffs against them.

attributes.action: Remove Parabens,Artificial Colour,Flavour & Preservatives from Infant Medication
attributes.background: Make all pharmaceutical companies removed parabens, all artificial colours, flavours and preservatives currently found in liquid medications, primarily used by parents for young children and especially babies. Babies should definitely not be exposed to parabens in this way.
attributes.additional_details:
Parabens have been proven to adversely affect the reproductive systems in rats and have no place in childrens medications

There is evidence that parabens and para- hydroxybenzoic acid may act as oestrogenic endocrine disruptors. Source below:
http://www.breastcanceruk.org.uk/science-and-research/parabens/
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/ruth-romano/parabens-and-breast-cance_b_15963020.html
They should not be contained in product given to babies i.e. immature reproductive system/pre puberty

attributes.action: Lower the drinking age to 16.
attributes.background: 16 is the legal age of consent and if you are thought resonsible enough to have a sexual relationship why aren't you thought responsible enough to drink safely?
attributes.additional_details: At the age of 16 you have finished high school and are staring sixthform or starting an apprenticeship. At this age you are responsible enough to handle money and know right from wrong.
